intro: Peucedanum miquelianum, commonly known as Miquelian angelica, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs such as parsley and carrots. The plant features tall, hollow stems and large, feather-like leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. The roots and leaves contain various bioactive compounds, contributing to its use in herbal remedies.
